result.execSummary:
The defendant Brandon George Jenkins was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possess Drug Paraphernalia [Modifiers: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime], an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.573(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt: to Withdraw as Counsel
to Withdraw
Marquette County DNA Proof of Submission

3:32 PM Defendant Brandon George Jenkins appeared by video.  Attorney Saralinda R Watts appeared by video for Brandon George Jenkins.  Prosecuting attorney Clifford C. Burdon appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin. 
Atty Watts states that the matter is resolved and has filed the paperwork.  
Court questions the defendant regarding in-person appearance.  Defendant waives their in-person appearance today & will proceed by zoom. 

Atty Burdon states plea agreement to Count 2.  Count 1 to be dismissed and read-in. Atty Watts agrees.  Defendant agrees.

Court questions defendant regarding plea. Advises of Constitutional Rights and elements of the charge.  Defendant enters a No Contest plea.  
Court finds plea made knowingly, voluntarily & Intelligently.  Court relies on the criminal complaint for a factual basis.  

BY THE COURT:  Court finds a sufficient factual basis to support the charges.  Court accepts defendant's plea and finds the defendant guilty of count 2 and orders the judgment of conviction as of today's date.
Count 1 to be dismissed and read-in.

Atty Burdon makes sentencing recommendations.
Atty Watts makes sentencing arguments.

BY THE COURT:  Count 2:  Court Costs = $243.00
Submit DNA sample within 60 days and pay surcharge = $200.00
Drug Surcharge = $10.00
Cash bond to be applied
Defendant agrees to the $15.00 payment plan fee.
Payment Plan for the balance:  $50.00/month commencing on November 1, 2022

Count 1 to be dismissed and read-in

Atty Burdon files the information electronically with the Court.  Atty Watts and the Defendant received a copy of the information and waives its reading. Court advises defendant of maximum penalties.  Defendant understands. 
Atty Watts enters a Not Guilty plea.

BY THE COURT:  Court enters a Not Guilty plea on behalf of the defendant. 
set status
bond continued

2:46 PM Defendant Brandon George Jenkins appeared by video.  Attorney Saralinda R Watts appeared by video for Brandon George Jenkins.  Prosecuting attorney Clifford C. Burdon in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Atty Watts states that the defendant will be waiving the Prelim today and has discussed the waiver with his client.  Court questions the defendant regarding in-person appearance.  Defendant waives their in-person appearance today & will proceed by zoom. 

Court questions the defendant.  Defendant agrees with the waiver.  Court accepts the waiver of the Prelim.

  BY THE COURT:  Court finds probable cause that a felony was committed and this defendant committed it.  Case bound over for trial or further proceedings.
Status hearing scheduled for October 3, 2022 at 03:30 pm.
Status hearing on October 3, 2022 at 03:30 pm.
to Preliminary Hearing

BY THE COURT:  Set for preliminary hearing.

10:11 AM Prosecuting attorney Brian J. Juech appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Brandon George Jenkins appeared by video.  Attorney Saralinda R Watts in court for Brandon George Jenkins. 
Atty Watts has not spoke with her client yet but she received a copy of the criminal complaint & waives it's reading. Defendant received it during the bail hearing.  Court advises defendant of maximum penalties.  Defendant understands. 
Atty Watts waives time limits for the Prelim.  Defendant doesn't know what waiver of the time limits mean.  Court explains the time limits.  Defendant agrees and waives time limits.

BY THE COURT: Defendant waives time limits for the preliminary hearing.

records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Defendant

records.addlTxt: *No possession of drug paraphernalia

3:21 PM Defendant Brandon George Jenkins appeared by video, in custody.  Plaintiff State of Wisconsin appeared by video.  Attorney Brian Juech appeared by video for State of Wisconsin. 
Atty Thompson from Public Defender's office states that the defendant will need to apply to her office; she has no spoke with the defendant at all.  
Defendant received a copy of the criminal complaint.  Court confirms address.  Court advises defendant of right to an attorney.  Defendant understands and will call the PD office.
Court finds probable cause for the charges for Riverside purposes. 

Atty Juech requests a $250 cash bond with conditions.
Defendant was hoping for a signature bond.

BY THE COURT:  Court sets a $250 Cash bond with conditions: 
*No possession of any drug paraphernalia
Initial appearance scheduled for June 13, 2022 at 10:00 am.
Initial appearance on June 13, 2022 at 10:00 am.
